description: Seven years ago, Deir ez-Zor was under threat from IS formations, with the city's defenses held by General Isam Zahreddin. The city was only accessible by helicopter at an altitude of over 4000 meters.
location: Deir ez-Zor, Deir ez-Zor Governorate, Syria
original:
Seven years ago I visited D. Zor for the first time. Before that, I knew about this city solely from information from the Internet and stories from people who had visited it. There was not a single Russian serviceman there at that time. The city itself was surrounded by IS formations for hundreds of kilometers. The threat of breaking through the defenses and liquidating this island of resistance to the Islamic state hung over him every hour. The defense of the city at that time was held by the man who makes the Syrian military conflict a legend - General Isam Zahreddin.
    It was possible to get to D. Zor only by helicopter at an altitude of over 4000 meters. At that time there was no other way to get to D. Zor.

event: 10th Anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea
description: Crimean residents were awarded for their successful activities in various spheres of the economy and public life, marking the 10th anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea. The Constitution has been a crucial basis for integration processes and unity among the peoples of Crimea, symbolizing the region's development as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation.
original:
Forwarded from: Aksyonov Z 82
Today marks the 10th anniversary of the Constitution of the Republic of Crimea. I am pleased to present well-deserved awards and insignia to Crimean residents for successful activities in various spheres of the economy and public life.

The adoption of the main legal document of the republic has become an important basis for integration processes and the unity of the peoples of Crimea, a symbol of the formation and development of our region as a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation. Our Constitution enshrines the values for which we fought during the Crimean Spring.

All these years, Crimeans have been united and inspired to new achievements by their love for their native land, their love for Russia. Together we are building the future of Russian Crimea and confidently moving forward. There are still many tasks ahead. I am confident that we will cope with all challenges with honor and overcome everything!

description: An officer, after a 10-year hiatus, returned to training conscripts. He found that the young men, aged 19, were like 'plasticine' and could be molded into effective soldiers with proper training and motivation. The officer believes that commanders should have faith in their conscripts and teach them military skills from the start, rather than underestimating their abilities.
original:
Forwarded from: The Science of Winning
Young men in whom they do not believe. Hello, dear readers of the channel. The other day we worked with a contingent with whom I have not worked for about 10 years. And, what’s most interesting, nothing has changed in 10 years. Let's talk about this. Conscript.
Here I am, an officer who once left the soldiers for the professional league and, by the will of fate, after many years, teaching them again. These 19-year-old boys are standing and looking at me. I don’t know what they told them about me, but they don’t make noise, but silently peer. Well, it's time to make men out of boys. We take on the preparation of conscripts.

After the first day, the surprise of the young people knew no bounds. It turns out that you can serve in the army, just like in commercials. Many of the young soldiers, during breaks between classes, came up and thanked us for showing them how they can and should serve their Motherland. And from the height of my life’s journey I cannot understand how one can serve differently...

These young people are like plasticine. How you train him now is how he will be later. If from the first days of his life in the army you show him what combat training is, take a lot of care and show little pity, then these puppies will grow up to be real wolfhounds. He is 19, he is young and does not realize all the risks, his body recovers faster from injuries and stress. This young man is most often ready to absorb new information, especially when he wants from the army what is shown in advertising. Command staff. But the commanders of these young men have much less faith in their guys than I, the instructor, who is investing in them here and now science to win. They think these guys are only made for sweeping, cleaning and other boring army activities. And these same commanders then offer these young men a contract. How is it that you want, comrade commanders, to turn a conscript-provider into a contract wolfhound within one day after signing a contract? There are no miracles. If you want to get yourself a contract specialist, start teaching him military skills during the “emergency” period. Otherwise, don’t expect that these guys will be capable of anything. If you suffer for a long time, something will work out. But we just suffered for a week, and what happened was not something, but well-coordinated squads in an entire infantry company under the leadership of young contract sergeants. During the training, the boys enjoyed it so much that they tried very hard, sometimes we were even a little worried that while working on the training questions they would not injure themselves... And you, mothers, do not be afraid for your children. They are 19-20, already adults. If they need your help, they will let you know, but don't run after them. Give them independence. Bottom line: Conscripts are not downtrodden children. These are puppies that can be turned into dogs of war. It depends on how you treat them and how to train them. Commander, don’t fuck these kids up, it was their peers who drove thirty-year-old bearded men through the mountains of Afghanistan and Chechnya. Why are they worse now? Motivate, train and provide. And then these guys will do as much as the mobilized battalion will not do. Our youth are not lost, they just need to be taken care of.

WE need to get busy. #TRAINING_METHODOLOGYTelegramScience of winning A project for those who want to study military science and competently apply the acquired knowledge.

If you have useful information or interesting materials and ...VIEW CHANNEL

description: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Kononenko, Nikolai Chub, and Alexander Grebenkin from the ISS congratulated Russia's residents on Cosmonautics Day, honoring Yuri Gagarin's 90th birthday. They emphasized the importance of unity in achieving the goal of space exploration.

description: A scientific conference was held at the Institute of Chemical Chemistry RAS in Moscow to discuss the implementation of Smart Control systems in the chemical industry. The conference, dedicated to the 90th anniversary of the institute and the 300th anniversary of the Russian Academy of Sciences, featured discussions on introducing digital technologies into chemical processes to optimize equipment and increase effectiveness.
original: The prospects for the implementation of Smart Control systems in the chemical industry were discussed in Moscow. A multidisciplinary scientific conference in the field of catalysis, petrochemical chemistry, membrane processes and industrial chemical technologies was held at the Institute of Chemical Chemistry RAS@tips_ras. It was dedicated to the 90th anniversary of the institute and timed to coincide with the 300th anniversary of the Russian Academy of Sciences. During the conference, at a meeting between the director of the Institute of Chemical Chemistry of the Russian Academy of Sciences, corresponding member of the Russian Academy of Sciences Anton Maksimov, and representatives of the institute with members of the Department of Chemistry and Materials Sciences of the Russian Academy of Sciences - academician-secretary Mikhail Egorov, deputy academician-secretary Academician Valentin Ananikov—discussed the introduction of Smart Control digital technologies into chemical processes. In the field of chemistry, “Smart Control” means the use of control systems using AI, various types of sensors and sensors to intensify chemical processes and optimize equipment, providing a significant increase their effectiveness and reliability. Valentin Ananikov also spoke at a scientific session dedicated to academician N.A. Plate, with a report on digital catalysis “Monoatomic and nanosized catalytic systems for organic synthesis.” For more information, visit the RAS website.

event: Emergency Shutdown Schedules Introduced in Ukraine
description: Following the destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, emergency shutdown schedules have been implemented in Ukraine. Local residents were informed of the schedules, which include planned outages of light, water, and hot water. The roads to the thermal power plant are currently blocked, with only military, police, and rescue services allowed access.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
After the destruction of the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, emergency shutdown schedules are being introduced in Ukraine. Ukrainian media reported this with reference to local residents.

A resident of Kyiv, whose house is located next to the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, said that she was informed about the schedule in the morning.

“In the morning they called us and told us to close the windows and warned that they would turn off the light and water, and there would be no hot water at all. They said that cold water would be available today from 18:00 to 21:00, and tomorrow from 09:00 to 10:00 and from 12:00 to 14:00,” says the woman.

Meanwhile, the roads to the thermal power plant are completely blocked. No one except the military, police and rescue services are allowed there.

The event was broadcast live in dozens of Russian cities, including Moscow, Yekaterinburg, Chelyabinsk, Novosibirsk, Ufa, Tyumen, Samara, Nizhny Novgorod, and Volgograd, on huge digital street screens.
original: Earlier then others. Well, almost.⚡️The Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage after two cancellations on Tuesday and Wednesday...The broadcast of the first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy three-stage launch vehicle was shown live in dozens of Russian cities , this is stated in a message from the MAER media holding. The broadcast was organized on huge digital street screens in Moscow, Yekaterinburg, Chelyabinsk, Novosibirsk, Ufa, Tyumen, Samara, Nizhny Novgorod, Volgograd and other cities. The project was implemented within the framework of the agreement between Roscosmos and MAER, signed by the head of the state corporation Yuri Borisov and the founder and general director of the media holding Konstantin Mayor.

They delivered gifts, including sports equipment, from Yaroslavl children and teachers to Akimovka schools. In return, the Akimov schools gifted paintings and crafts made from Azov Sea shells.

Recently, representatives of the Popular Front delivered parcels from Yaroslavl children and teachers to Akimovka schools, as well as balls for various sports and jump ropes. They did not return empty-handed. Akimov schools were asked to donate gifts in return: paintings, crafts made from shells from the coast of the Azov Sea.

event: Interline Agreement between Aeroflot and KrasAvia
description: Aeroflot and KrasAvia signed an interline agreement, enabling passengers to purchase a single ticket for flights on both airlines. This partnership will expand Aeroflot's flight geography from the Krasnoyarsk hub through partner flights.
original:
Aeroflot and KrasAvia entered into an interline agreement Aeroflot and KrasAvia entered into an interline agreement that will allow passengers to issue a single ticket for airline flights. Thanks to the interline agreement, Aeroflot will be able to expand the geography of flights from the Krasnoyarsk hub at the expense of partner flights. AVIA.RU reports this.

Last March, at the Krasnoyarsk Economic Forum, Aeroflot and KrasAvia signed an agreement aimed at developing regional and interregional air transportation in the Krasnoyarsk Territory based on the Krasnoyarsk International Airport. The main goal of cooperation is to provide the widest possible opportunities for air travel both within the region and beyond. The parties also intend to work together aimed at improving the quality of passenger service.aviaru.net/n269981

description: In Kabardino-Balkaria, two armed men opened fire on Russian Federal Security Service officers who were attempting to detain them for extremist and terrorist activities. The officers returned fire, killing the attackers. Several firearms, ammunition, and grenades were seized at the scene.
original:
In Kabardino-Balkaria, a criminal case has been opened regarding an encroachment on the lives of law enforcement officers. The Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of the Investigative Committee for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic has opened a criminal case on the grounds of crimes under Part 2 of Art. 222 (illegal acquisition, storage and carrying of weapons committed by a group of persons), Part 2 of Article 222.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (illegal acquisition, transfer, sale, storage, transportation or carrying of explosives or explosive devices, committed by a group of persons by prior conspiracy), as well as Article 317 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (attack on the life of law enforcement officers).
On April 11, at approximately 4 a.m., while officers of the Russian Federal Security Service for the Kabardino-Balkarian Republic were carrying out measures to locate and detain persons carrying out extremist and terrorist activities, two armed men were discovered in one of the gardening partnerships in the vicinity of the city of Nalchik. When the law enforcement officers demanded that they surrender, these persons opened fire on them from the firearms they had with them. Two attackers were killed by return fire. Investigators and criminologists from the Investigative Committee, during an inspection of the scene of the incident, discovered and seized several firearms, ammunition and grenades. Subscribe to Sledkom

description: OJ Simpson, a renowned athlete and actor, passed away at the age of 76. He was known for his sports achievements, film roles, and high-profile criminal cases, including the murder trial of his ex-wife and her lover, as well as his imprisonment for armed robbery and kidnapping.
original:
Athlete and actor Oriental James Simpson has died at the age of 76. He died on Wednesday, April 10. His family announced his death.

In addition to his numerous sports achievements and film roles, OJ Simpson is known for his high-profile criminal case in the mid-1990s. He was accused of killing his ex-wife Nicole Brown-Simpson and her lover Ronald Goldman. In October 1995, a criminal court found Simpson not guilty of murder. However, in early 1997, a civil court found him guilty of unlawful death, for which Simpson was fined $33.5 million.

In 2008, a Las Vegas court sentenced him to 33 years in prison for armed robbery and kidnapping. He was pardoned in June 2017 and was released from prison in October of that year.

In February of this year, it became known that Simpson was diagnosed with prostate cancer. The life and career of the sports star, who became famous, among other things, for his problems with the law, is in the Kommersant certificate. Photo: Charles LeBlanc/Flickr@kommersant

description: The first launch of Angara-A5 from the Vostochny cosmodrome marks a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier, capable of lifting 24.5 tons into orbit, paves the way for new Russian space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights. The successful launch also boosts high-tech sectors of the economy.
original:
There is the first launch of "Angara-A5" from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that Angara-A5 from Vostochny completed the entire flight program the first time. Huge respect to the specialists of Roscosmos!!! You are our pride.

description: A devastating flood in Orenburg destroyed 200 houses and household plots in the village of Dubovy Plyos. Residents attempted to salvage their belongings by boat, but the water had already reached the roofs. Over 2,000 houses and 2,500 plots with buildings were affected.
original:
Water completely flooded a cottage community in Orenburg. Residents returned there by boat to save their pets and at least some things, but it turned out to be too late.

The flood destroyed 200 houses and household plots in the village of Dubovy Plyos. In the morning, locals tried to get to their homes by boat to take what was left, but the water had already reached the roofs. By this time, more than 2,000 houses and 2,500 plots with buildings had already been flooded in Orenburg.

The level in the Urals rose to 1060 centimeters. The peak of the flood is expected on April 12. Water-filling dams are being installed in the city to prevent water from reaching neighborhoods. Subscribe to Mash

event: Restoration of College and School in Severodonetsk
description: The restoration of two key facilities in Severodonetsk has been completed: the college of industrial, construction and household technologies and the school. The college, which had not been renovated in almost 60 years, was fully restored to train 140 future construction industry specialists. The school was also overhauled, with the installation of a fire alarm and video surveillance system, and will now accommodate 500 students.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
The restoration of two important facilities in Severodonetsk has been completed - the college of industrial, construction and household technologies and the school.

In the college building, which had not been renovated for almost 60 years, specialists restored all load-bearing structures, repaired the roof, replaced windows and engineering systems, and carried out a range of finishing works. Now the updated college will be able to train about 140 future specialists in the construction industry: welders, assemblers, masons, painters. Today the republic is in dire need of such professionals. I have no doubt that these guys will contribute to its restoration.
  
The builders not only overhauled the Severodonetsk school, but also installed a fire alarm and video surveillance system there. In updated and comfortable classrooms, 500 young residents of the city will now be able to gain knowledge.

These are the latest results of the enormous work that is being carried out in Severodonetsk thanks to the close attention of the federal authorities and personally Marat Shakirzyanovich Khusnullin, who is in charge of these processes. Many thanks to PPK “Unified Customer” for the active restoration of one of the cities most affected by Ukrainian shelling.

description: A dialysis patient in the Simferopol region has been unable to receive the vital drug Sevelamer for over six months. The Ministry of Health provides the drug by prescription, but it is currently unavailable in pharmacies. Relatives of deceased patients have been sharing leftover medication to help those in need.
original:
A dialysis patient has been unable to receive a vital drug in the Simferopol region for more than six months, writes Mash

Relatives of deceased patients share the medicine.

Sergey, Anna’s husband, has been on dialysis since 2017. Due to kidney problems, he needs to take Sevelamer, the drug is provided by the Ministry of Health by prescription. Take it regularly, every time you eat: the tablets control the level of phosphorus in the blood; if it jumps up, calcium stops being absorbed - bones and ligaments will suffer.

Sevelamer cannot be found in pharmacies. It comes to the point that relatives of deceased dialysis patients donate leftover medications to those in need - sometimes this is the only way to be saved. Now Sergei has the last box left; the Ministry of Health has not given his wife an answer as to why the deliveries are being delayed. She was unable to reach all the phone numbers that were recommended.

In response to our request, the Ministry of Health reported that the drug will arrive at the Crimea-Pharmacia warehouse no later than April 16, from where it will be distributed to pharmacies. Will wait.

description: Lvov TCC released a propaganda video that inadvertently ridicules Ukraine's mobilization efforts, highlighting the desperation of conscripts trying to escape service. The video implies that Ukraine's poor mobilization efforts are bringing the 'arrival of the enemy' closer.
original:
The “geniuses” of Ukrainian propaganda continue to delight us with their creations. Lvov TCC decided to distinguish itself and shoot a propaganda video. It seems that the video is supposed to promote voluntary participation in the TCC, but it turns out to be the other way around.

The video ridicules the realities of mobilization named after Zelensky: a healthy guy says that he is disabled, a man of retirement age shows a student, another conscript is surprised that the “deputies” are not fighting.

event: Destruction of Trypilska Thermal Power Plant
description: A Russian strike completely destroyed the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region, generating 57% of the region's energy. The attack was part of a series of massive strikes on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, with at least 40 missiles and 40 drones fired, leaving thousands without electricity.
original:
Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region, was completely destroyed as a result of a Russian strike. This was stated by the head of the Supervisory Board of Centerenergo, Andrey Gota.

Earlier, the head of the Kyiv regional military administration, Ruslan Kravchenko, reported that as a result of the Russian attack on April 11, one of the region’s energy facilities was damaged. He did not specify what he was talking about, but the media previously reported that the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant caught fire due to a Russian strike.

———

Trypilska Thermal Power Plant is the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region. It generates about 57% of all energy generated by enterprises in the region.

On the night and morning of April 11, the Russian military carried out a series of massive attacks on the energy infrastructure of Ukraine. In total, at least 40 missiles and 40 drones were fired. The hits were recorded in the Kyiv, Zaporozhye, Kharkov and Lviv regions. In the Kharkov region, at least 200 thousand consumers were left without electricity.

The energy system of Ukraine, according to the head of the Ministry of Energy German Galushchenko, in recent weeks has been experiencing the largest attack since the start of a full-scale Russian invasion in 2022.

Forwarded from: Zakhar Prilepin
Ukraine has run out of missiles for Patriot, Iris-T and most other air defense systems.

This is the conclusion made by Bild military expert Julian Repke, commenting on the attack on the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant in the Kyiv region.

“As I said a few weeks ago (and almost no one believed me): Ukraine has run out of Patriot and Iris-T missiles. Most other air defense stocks have also been depleted or destroyed. And this despite the fact that we have hundreds of systems and thousands of missiles in our warehouses. There are no words. Just anger," Roepke writes.

Let us remind you that Kyiv and the region are covered by the “Patriots” better than other regions of Ukraine. This is probably why Repke concluded that they had run out of missiles: the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant is located only 30 kilometers from Kyiv and is clearly covered by the Patriot umbrella.

description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov addressed a meeting of BRICS countries' parliamentary committees, emphasizing the formation of a multipolar world order. He advocated for a unifying international agenda, promoting development for all states and peoples, rather than just a select few. Lavrov highlighted BRICS' role in facilitating this process, respecting each country's development path and focusing on collective problem-solving.
original:
Speech by Sergey Lavrov during a meeting with representatives of relevant parliamentary committees on international affairs of the BRICS countries (Moscow, April 11, 2024)
Main points:
Show more
• Today the world is truly at a turning point, a milestone stage in its development. This is due to the ongoing process of formation of a multipolar world order. We see how the states of the World Majority intend to further strengthen their positions in the international arena and pursue independent, nationally oriented foreign policy courses.
• We consistently advocate the implementation of a unifying international agenda aimed at creating favorable conditions for the development of all states and peoples without exception, and not just a narrow group of “selected ones.”
Unfortunately, the “collective West”, led by the United States, does not abandon attempts, if not to reverse this objective historical process, then at least to delay the onset of inevitable changes.
• Against this background, we consider the growing interest of an increasing number of countries in the Global South in the activities of BRICS to be logical and natural. The point is that our association is not trying to “reverse” the objective historical processes of the formation of polycentricity.
On the contrary, BRICS strives to facilitate them in every possible way and lead them, but to do this not in its own narrow selfish interests, but in the interests of all its (and not only its) members, but also of all countries that want to interact with BRICS.
• Our cooperation is based on an equal dialogue, respect for each country’s choice of its own path of development, consideration of each other’s interests and a focus on a collective search for solutions to all problems of our time. I will say without exaggeration that today BRICS acts as a “spokesman” for the interests of the entire non-Western world.
• We have no doubt that the involvement of a wide range of developing countries in interaction with the association will contribute to the further consolidation of the efforts of the World Majority to solve common problems in common interests.
Read in full: https://vk.cc/cw7zIv

description: A search and rescue operation was conducted in Chukotka after a family fell through the ice while crossing on snowmobile. The young girl, who managed to contact rescuers, was found by volunteers but unfortunately, neither she nor the volunteers reached the transshipment base. An Mi-8 helicopter and over 20 volunteers and Ministry of Emergency Situations employees searched for the child, ultimately discovering her body.
original:
In Chukotka, the body of a girl was found, whose family fell through the ice - the child managed to contact rescuers and joined the volunteers, but they never reached the transshipment base. In Chukotka, the operation to search for the missing little girl continued for several hours: she was the only one who survived crossing the ice section on snowmobile with the whole family. Her parents fell through the ice. The girl remained on the surface and even managed to call rescuers, and later volunteers found her.

Unfortunately, neither the child nor the volunteers reached the transshipment base of the reindeer herding brigade. Then an Mi-8 flew out to search for them, and on the ground more than 20 volunteers and employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations searched for the child. Later, sad news arrived that rescuers, according to preliminary data, discovered the body of a girl from a helicopter, said the head of the region, Vladislav Kuznetsov. Search efforts will continue when weather conditions improve.

description: Human rights activists Asmik Novikova and Narek Hakobyan met with Anatoly Shchetinin, a Russian emigrant detained at a military base in Gyumri. Shchetinin, wanted in Russia for evading service, decided to return to Russia, citing no complaints against the authorities. He had no means of subsistence and was in Armenia illegally, possibly due to psychological stress.
original:
Human rights activists reported details of a meeting with a detained emigrant at a military base in Gyumri. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF FOREIGN AGENT MEMO LLC. 18+

Anatoly Shchetinin, put on the wanted list in his homeland for evading service, decided to return to Russia and stated that he had no complaints against the Russian authorities, Asmik Novikova and Narek Hakobyan said after meeting with the Russian. Shchetinin had no means of subsistence, and was in Armenia illegally. Probably, psychological stress was the reason why he decided to return to his homeland and go to the Northern Military District zone, his friend said.

Human rights activists noticed that Shchetinin’s behavior is similar to the behavior of those prisoners who first ask for legal assistance, and when human rights activists come to their colony, they refuse it. “This, of course, leads us to some thoughts. <...> But it should be noted that Shchetinin believes in the successful outcome of his story, he is not scared, not depressed, there are no visible traces of violence on him,” said Asmik Novikova.

The human rights activist said that, according to Shchetinin, they had already tried to take him to Russia twice, but they could not do this, since he was prohibited from entering the country. Novikova noted that the version of a ban on entry into Russia looks absurd, since Shchetinin has Russian citizenship. “Rather, this is due to the professional performance of the duties of the Armenian border service,” she believes. Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/398931 Caucasian Knot Human rights activists reported details of the meeting with Shchetinin at the base in Gyumri Anatoly Shchetinin, announced at home in wanted for evading service, decided to return...

description: Argentina's President Javier Milei is pursuing a partnership with NATO, aiming to become a 'global partner' of the North Atlantic Alliance. This move raises questions about the country's location in the South Atlantic and its potential implications for regional security agreements.
original:
Forwarded from: Sergio Brilev / Sergio Brilev
And the neighbors of the Argentines (link to the Uruguayan publication Caras y Carretas) will reprint the information that Miley wants not only to buy 24 F-16s from NATO Denmark, but also to achieve for Argentina the status of a “global partner” of NATO, that is, the North Atlantic Alliance.
I dare to remind you that Argentina is located in the SOUTH Atlantic.
Of course, on the one hand, we can say that the US/NATO partners are also countries from completely different oceans: Japan and Australia.
On the other hand, I recall that in 1986 the UN General Assembly (at the initiative of Brazil) adopted a resolution on the South Atlantic Peace and Cooperation Zone, which advocated the non-proliferation of nuclear weapons in the region and the non-presence of armed forces from other parts of the world.
In addition, separately, South America (under the Treaty of Tlatelolco), and Africa (under the Treaty of Pelindaba), and Antarctica, which form the shores of the South Atlantic, are nuclear-free zones.
True, all this does not apply to the territories of NATO countries located in the South Atlantic (Norwegian island of Bouvet, British St. Helena, etc.)
We are waiting for clarification. https://www.carasycaretas.com.uy/mundo/javier-milei-procura-que-argentina-se-asocie-la-otan-n72607/ampwww.carasycaretas.com.uyJavier Milei procura que Argentina se asocie a la OTANEl presidente argentino Javier Milei envió al ministro de Defensa a Bruselas para llegar a un acuerdo que le permita a Argentina ser socio de la OTAN.

description: Dennis W., a Hamburg resident and official, was convicted of sexually harassing two Ukrainian refugee boys, aged 9 and 11, whom he had lured to Germany with promises of help. He threatened to deport their family if they resisted. The investigation found a collection of child pornography, including some with his participation, and evidence of sharing details with another pedophile.
original:
Details of the case of Hamburg resident Dennis W., who harassed the sons of a Ukrainian refugee, are published by Moin.

It is reported that after the outbreak of war in Ukraine, a married man (according to Bild - an official) lured a woman named Yana and her four children (two boys and two girls) to Germany through social networks, offering them help.

He helped with accommodation - by renting them an apartment in his own house - he convinced neighbors to share furniture, gave expensive gifts, and invited the family to spend leisure time together.

But in fact, he committed sexual acts with boys aged 9 and 11 years old. And when they tried to resist this, he threatened to “deport” their family back to Ukraine.

What exactly he did with them was revealed only at the trial, but the Ukrainian woman who came to the hearing did not understand German, and it is unknown whether the translator explained everything to her.

The pedophile demanded that the children not tell anything, but they still confessed to their mother, and she contacted the police. Law enforcement officers who came to search the man found a whole collection of child pornography in his home, including some with his participation.

As the investigation found, the defendant shared details of his actions with Ukrainian children with another pedophile. And he said that he would continue to do this “until the children themselves find it exciting.”

Dennis brought his collection of child pornography from Thailand, where he used the services of child prostitution. It is interesting that the lawyer tried to portray this as a “mitigating circumstance” (they say that the defendant could not control himself after such “tours”), but the court dismissed this consideration.

As a result, the German received eight years with the need for treatment. The judge said that if the case had been heard in the US, the pedophile would have received 20 years, "but we have to comply with German laws."

Interestingly, this is not the first such case for Dennis V. In 2010, the Hamburg media wrote that a man with the same name was convicted of sex with a 14-year-old teenager, but got off with a suspended sentence and a fine.TelegramCountryPoliticsIn Germany, a local official was convicted , who harassed the children of Ukrainian refugees under threat of deportation, Bild reports.

The Regional Court of Hamburg is...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Ukrainian parliament adopted a bill on tightening mobilization in Ukraine, with 283 deputies voting in favor. The law will come into force in mid-May and introduces electronic summonses, a ban on driving, and the blocking of bank accounts of evaders.
original:
The Rada adopted in the second reading a bill on tightening mobilization in Ukraine. 283 deputies voted in favor, and there are 450 seats in the Ukrainian parliament, media reports. The document will come into force a month after the president signs it, that is, probably in mid-May.

It is noted that the rules on demobilization after 36 months of service were excluded from the bill. At the same time, the new law provides for the introduction of electronic summonses, a ban on driving, and the blocking of bank accounts of evaders.

In total, more than 4 thousand amendments were proposed to the law, which made the adoption of the document significantly more difficult.

As experts note, despite the noise around the mobilization bill, its real impact on the possible course of the conflict is somewhat exaggerated: the office of Vladimir Zelensky and the TCC have enough “legal and illegal grounds for carrying out total mobilization,” writes the Vzglyad publication. However, the President and Parliament of Ukraine For a number of reasons, they are trying to legalize existing practices and expand them. “The amendments being discussed in the Rada cannot significantly change the situation at the front. However, if Zelensky manages to maintain the scale of mobilization, then he will thereby slow down the Russian advance at the front due to objective reasons - there will simply be more people in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, albeit poorly armed ones,” believes Ukrainian political scientist Vladimir Skachko. According to observers, the very process of adopting the bill highlighted the problem of destabilizing the parliamentary system of Ukraine, since the presidential faction of the Servant of the People party did not have enough votes, which is why there was bargaining in the Rada between the government and the opposition.

Currently, 37 household plots remain flooded in three settlements: the villages of Kizilskoye, Paris, Bazhova village. There are no flooded residential buildings," the message says.

According to the department, over the past 24 hours, fluctuations in water levels from minus 93 to plus 60 cm were observed at gauging stations. Photo: EMERCOM of Russia/TASS@interfaxonline

Another launcher, as well as a 30N6 illumination and guidance radar, were cut by shrapnel and disabled. Also, when watching the video, you can notice the almost simultaneous arrival of two missiles with different warheads - high-explosive fragmentation and cassette, which increased the likelihood of hitting enemy equipment. ❗️ All this again speaks of the growth of the reconnaissance and fire capabilities of the Russian Armed Forces to destroy enemy air defense systems in areas remote from the LBS. event: Launch of Latin America - Russia Business Association
description: The Latin America - Russia business association was launched to facilitate trade relations between the two regions. The focus is on cooperation in various areas, including innovation and IT solutions, rather than just raw material exchange. The association aims to unite entrepreneurs and the state to reduce customs duties, build logistics, and enable payment in national currencies.
original:
Forwarded from: NECHAYEV
Direction - America We launched the work of the Latin America - Russia business association. We see a huge demand for trade relations. And not for the exchange of raw materials, but for full-fledged cooperation in a variety of areas, including innovation and our IT solutions.

Exports are constantly growing. Between Russia and China in the first two months of this year it increased by 9.3%. The situation is similar in our trade with India. But the direction associated with Latin America is still lagging behind. The association will help unite the efforts of entrepreneurs and the state.

The priority is to reduce customs duties, build logistics and pay in national currencies. These are the first steps from which a long and fruitful cooperation will begin. Together we will enter new markets and production chains. And at the same time we will promote the positive image of our country. Nechaev - subscribe

description: Evgeniy Andreevich Polovodov, a friend and colleague, died in the line of duty. He was a skilled officer who loved his job and was instrumental in capturing epic aviation shots. He will be remembered for his dedication and bravery.
original:
Forwarded from: Notes from a Photojournalist
Evgeniy Andreevich Polovodov died today.

We met Zheka about 9 years ago in the city of Murom and immediately became friends. For some reason, I remembered how we gave him the book “The Adventures of the Good Soldier Schweik,” because it was very appropriate in that situation.

“Evgeny Andreevich, hello!” - that’s how we usually joked when we met, because our first and middle names were the same.

We shot a lot of materials together, shared experience and optics on the set. All the most epic aviation shots were made thanks to Zheka.

I remember how he returned from a Syrian business trip and immediately came to me.

In the first days of the Northern Military District, we collected humanitarian aid for our guys from the press service: armored armor, warm clothes, first aid kits. We brought them to Zheka and his team.

Zheka was a real officer, albeit a “JACKET”, but he could give odds to many career “officers”. He loved his job and died in the line of duty.

Brother, sleep well...

description: Telecom operators in Russia are expected to support new regulations, which may require them to prohibit subscribers from transferring money from an account linked to a SIM card and to collect biometrics from foreign citizens, including labor migrants, to buy a SIM card. Operators seem to be in favor of these regulations as they will gain access to additional valuable information from banks.
original:
Forwarded from: About tech and these
Typically, telecom operators resist any additional regulations that regulators try to impose on them. They do not resist only if it a) does not require additional effort from them, b) does not affect their financial flows and does not lead to an outflow of subscribers, c) gives access to additional information.

Today, two parallel articles on this topic were published in Kommersant and Vedomosti. The first is that telecom operators may be required to prohibit subscribers from transferring money from an account linked to a SIM card (although we read the note and still did not understand what kind of accounts we are talking about: if about bank accounts, then how can operators regulate this - completely unclear). The second is that foreign citizens, including labor migrants, will be required to take biometrics in order to buy a SIM card from a Russian operator.

In both texts, operators seem to be very much looking forward to and ardently supporting the new regulation. Why? It seems because in order for these requirements to be technically feasible, operators will have to exchange information with banks much more intensively than they currently do. And any additional information costs money and is therefore valuable. Kommersant Communications will be cut off pending an investigation Suspected of fraud will be able to block funds in the subscriber’s account

description: Aeroflot pilots mistakenly landed on the wrong runway at Sheremetyevo Airport, flying an Airbus A320 from Saratov to Moscow. The controller had instructed them to occupy runway 06 right, but the crew failed to turn, and instead continued to fly centered. The dispatcher's quick thinking prevented a potential tragedy by prohibiting other aircraft from crossing the central runway.
location: Sheremetyevo International Airport, Khimki, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Aeroflot pilots mistook the runway at Sheremetyevo and landed on the runway on which planes take off.

Airbus A320 was flying from Saratov to Moscow. On approach to the capital, the controller gave the command to occupy runway 06 right - one of two operating runways. The crew confirmed the information, but the plane continued to fly centered. Five kilometers before landing, the controller gave permission to land on the right runway 06, expecting that the pilots would turn right, but the maneuver did not happen.

The tragedy was avoided due to the fact that the dispatcher realized in time that the pilots would not turn, and prohibited all other aircraft from crossing the central runway. The Aeroflot board landed there. Later, the modest dispatcher reported that he was in complete control of the situation and no longer focused the crew’s attention on the fact that they were entering the wrong lane.

description: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko met with Uzbekistan's Minister of Foreign Affairs Bakhtiyor Saidov to discuss ambitious goals, including achieving a trade turnover of a billion dollars. They also discussed creating joint ventures, such as BELAZ, and Belarus' membership in the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.
original:
Forwarded from: New Turkestan Gazette
Belarus and Uzbekistan have set ambitious goals for themselves and do not intend to deviate from them. President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko stated this in a meeting with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Uzbekistan Bakhtiyor Saidov, BelTA reports.

The head of state first of all thanked Bakhtiyor Saidov for the hospitality that was provided by the Uzbek side during the recent official visit of the President of Belarus to Tashkent, and also conveyed his best wishes and gratitude to the Uzbek leader Shavkat Mirziyoyev. “Back then we set ambitious plans for ourselves - to achieve a trade turnover of a billion dollars. I think that we do not have time to retreat anywhere, and there is no need. We are ready to play our role, I hope that Uzbekistan will too will also make every effort,” said Alexander Lukashenko. The President also expressed gratitude to Uzbekistan for supporting Belarus on its path to membership in the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.

“I ask you to pay special attention to the creation of joint ventures that we agreed on. We talked then about BELAZ and so on. Let’s work substantively in this direction. We are interested in this. We have something to offer Uzbekistan. I think that, being here in Belarus, if you want to see some of our enterprises, please, we will organize a visit to any enterprise at any time so that you can make sure that its products are acceptable for use in Uzbekistan,” the head of state suggested.

Alexander Lukashenko emphasized that Belarus has always been friendly and brotherly towards Uzbekistan and the people of this country. “You can rest assured that this will always be the case. I often say that we are very similar in our hard work, patriotism and attitude towards our state. Therefore, let’s fulfill the agreements that we reached then in Tashkent,” the president concluded.

Bakhtiyor Saidov, in turn, conveyed greetings from his Uzbek colleague to Alexander Lukashenko. “He specifically drew my attention and said: “Give my best wishes to my friend.” Naturally, the visit that you made to Uzbekistan is a historical visit,” the minister said.

According to him, Uzbekistan is ready to raise relations with Belarus to a qualitatively new level in all areas.TelegramPhoto/videoVIEW MESSAGE

description: In the Chelyabinsk region, a former policeman turned horse breeder, Nikolai I., neglected his horses, leading to their deaths from hunger, cold, and disease. Despite local attempts to intervene, Nikolai threatened them with a gun and continued to abandon the horses, even disposing of their corpses in the forest.
original:
In the Chelyabinsk region, an insane local resident caused a widespread pestilence among his own horses - the animals die from hunger, cold and disease, and the inadequate man also refuses to let them go. In one of the villages of the Chelyabinsk region, former policeman Nikolai I. was fond of horse breeding for a long time and acquired an impressive herd of horses. However, soon the man stopped caring for them - the pets were left to their own devices. As caring locals told Readovka, they were already trying to take away the poor people, who gradually began to die from disease, hypothermia and simply from hunger. This happened with a small foal that died due to a fracture.

However, all attempts to help were stopped by Nikolai, who rushed at people with a gun. As Readovka learned, if an animal dies, its corpse is carried deep into the forest, where it decomposes. According to local residents, the situation, which has been going on for five years, is worsening every year: the horse breeder began to drink and practically go crazy due to delirium tremens. Having tried to influence the man with Russian legislation, people began to write statements, but the visiting district police officer did nothing. UPD: the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the Chelyabinsk Region reported that Nikolai I. had never worked in the police.

description: As of March 4, 2024, NASA reports 27,942 artificial fragments in low-Earth orbit, an increase of 236 objects from three months prior. The majority of debris belongs to the USA, followed by Russia and China.
original:
Forwarded from: Chronicles of the Space Age
As reported in the NASA Orbital Debris Quarterly News (Volume 28, Issue 2, April 2024), as of March 4, 2024, 27,942 fragments of artificial origin are being monitored in low-Earth orbit by surveillance equipment, which is 236 objects more than three months earlier. . Of this number, 12,215 (+ 408) are spacecraft, active and “dead,” and 15,727 (– 172) are launch vehicle stages, structural fragments and other debris.
The largest amount of “space debris” is listed in the USA – 12601 (+ 333), incl. 7590 (+ 378) are satellites, and 5011 (– 45) are rocket stages and debris.
Russia is in second place – 7097 (– 72). In third place is China – 5004 (– 22).
This is followed by the UK - 702 (+ 6), France - 621 (+ 1), Japan - 319 (+ 4), India - 211 (- 2) and the European Space Agency - 124 (- 4).
All other countries account for 1263 fragments (–8).
The report does not report any new cases of defragmentation of space objects.

description: According to the French State Treasury's data, African countries owed France a total of 17,062.6 million euros in 2022. Morocco, Egypt, and Ivory Coast topped the list, with the franc zone countries (UEMOA and CEMAC) owing 5,980 million euros.
original:
Forwarded from: French West Africa Was Here
#economy#cooperation An analysis of data from the French State Treasury showed that in 2022, the total debt🌍of African countries to France🇫🇷 amounted to 17,062.6 million euros:

Morocco🇲🇦 tops the list with a debt of 3,105.63 million euros. It is followed by 🇪🇬Egypt with 1,583.60 million euros and 🇨🇮Ivory Coast with 1,483.05 million euros.

As for the debt of the franc zone countries (UEMOA and CEMAC), at the end of 2022 it reached 5,980 million euros. The UEMOA countries have a larger debt to France, amounting to €3,730 million, compared to €2,240 million for the CEMAC countries. Ivory Coast has the highest debt, followed by Senegal and Cameroon. Burkina, Mali, Niger and Benin are ranked 5th, 7th, 8th and 9th places respectively.

Tunisia🇹🇳, Kenya🇰🇪, Nigeria🇳🇬and Gabon🇬🇦are also among the largest debtors.

🚬I drank, smoked and fell asleep: a Rybnitsa resident started a fire in the apartment🧯A 34-year-old resident of Rybnitsa drank heavily with friends. description: The first launch of the Angara-A5M from the Vostochny cosmodrome marks a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier, capable of lifting 24.5 tons into orbit, will enable Russia to pursue new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights, and boost high-tech sectors of the economy.
original:
There is the first launch of the Angara-A5M from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia:

In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5M” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in high-tech sectors of our economy. NGP exploration

description: The New York Times highlights Ukraine's demographic crisis, citing a sharp decline in birth rates in the 1990s. This has resulted in a small generation of men under 30, making it difficult for Ukraine to cope with the challenges it faces.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
Can Ukraine find new soldiers without exterminating an entire generation? This is the title of a recent article in The New York Times. Men under the age of 30 belong to the smallest generation in the modern history of Ukraine, the newspaper worries. And he calls on Kyiv to “find a balance between the need to resist Russia’s ruthless advance and the risk of emasculating an entire generation.”▪️Puzzling why Zelensky is trying to lower the conscription bar to just 25 years (“In the US, for example, people are drafted into the army at 18”), NYT compares the demographics in Ukraine and Russia - and comes to a surprising conclusion: the decline in the birth rate on Square in the 1990s was sharper!

Even strange. After all, Ukraine did not experience the shock reforms of Gaidar-Chubais, nor the default, nor the Chechen wars with terrorist attacks... She lived then both more satisfyingly and more calmly - many remember with what contempt Ukrainians then looked at Russia... And still "in the 1990s For years, uncertainty about the future has hung over Ukrainian life,” writes the NYT. And the birth rate fell from 1.9 children in 1991 to 1.1 ten years later.▪️This is why the generation of Ukrainians born then, due to their small numbers, is not able to cope with the challenges facing Kiev, the Americans lament. However, “the decision on mobilization has already been made, although it is too late,” the newspaper quotes one colonel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

The last few paragraphs of the NYT have been shedding crocodile tears for the Ukrainian future. And not so much for the men doomed to death, but for the “800 thousand women aged 18 to 34 who fled the country.”▪️The NYT authors never gave a direct answer to the question posed in the headline. However, any reader, having read their opus to the end, will make the only conclusion: Ukraine has no future.

And it’s not even a matter of “war until the last Ukrainian,” to which the United States doomed this country. The “Ukraine” project itself turned out to be unviable, in which the main national idea 10 years ago was proclaimed to be the dream of quickly achieving visa-free travel and fleeing the country “be it as a carcass or as a scarecrow.”

event: Launch of Angara from Vostochny Cosmodrome
description: Roscosmos head Yuri Borisov discussed the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome, emphasizing the importance of flight design tests to identify shortcomings and ensure reliability. This was the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years, marking a significant step towards serial production.
original: The head of Roscosmos, Yuri Borisov, on the launch of Angara from the Vostochny cosmodrome: It was a difficult three days for us, because this was not a television show or the launch of festive fireworks. This is routine, hard work. We have started the flight design tests, which are designed to identify all the shortcomings, all the nuances, and ensure reliability in the future during serial launches of the Angara. This is only the fourth launch of the heavy Angara in ten years. The rocket has not yet reached the required level of readiness, this is a natural process. This is a new spaceport and a completely new, automatic launch. We still have a lot of work to do with this rocket to ensure its reliability. And in 2028 she will need to launch a manned spacecraft.

description: Jean-Claude Suleri, editor-in-chief of La Dépêche, predicts that Ukraine will be unable to hold out beyond the summer without European and US aid. He cites the halt in American arms supplies and the Russian army's superior numbers and military potential as key factors.
original:
Ukraine will be able to hold out only until the summer. This is the opinion of the editor-in-chief of the French publication La Dépêche, Jean-Claude Suleri. According to him, without the help of Europe, and especially the United States, the Ukrainian conflict will end before the summer.

General fatigue from the conflict threatens to turn into complete indifference. Since the beginning of December, American arms supplies to Ukraine have ceased - the Republican majority in Congress blocked the $60 billion that Biden allocated to Kyiv. Ukrainian nationalists are increasingly feeling the shortage of weapons. “If we continue to wait for help from Europe, and especially from the United States, then everything will end before the summer - in a month or two Ukraine will no longer be able to cope with the situation,” says Jean-Claude Suleri. He emphasizes that the Russian army significantly exceeds the Ukrainian one in the number of soldiers and 10 times in military potential. Moscow is restoring its missile reserves and continuing its offensive. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

original:
Forwarded from: Komsomolskaya Pravda: KP.RU

Three people on a snowmobile were driving along an ice patch from the village of Egvekinot to the village of Konergino. But suddenly two adults, along with the vehicle, fell through the ice. The girl was able to stay on the surface and immediately called rescuers.

description: On the International Day of Remembrance of Concentration Camp Prisoners, the Kostogryzovskaya school held thematic classes to educate children about the atrocities of the Nazis during the Great Patriotic War and the concentration camps where prisoners were abused.
original:
Classes dedicated to the memory of the victims of concentration camps were held at the Kostogryzovskaya school. On the International Day of Remembrance of Concentration Camp Prisoners, thematic classes were held at the Kostogryzovskaya school. The children were told about the atrocities of the Nazis during the Great Patriotic War and about the concentration camps in which the Nazis abused prisoners.

The world-famous Nazi concentration camps in which tens and hundreds of thousands of prisoners were held and died included Auschwitz, Majdanek, Mauthausen, Sachsenhausen, Ravensbrück, Treblinka and Stutthof. Tens of thousands of victims also numbered in concentration camps throughout the Soviet Union.

The children learned about the history of the Buchenwald camp, whose prisoners staged an uprising against the Nazi occupiers. The class hour conducted by the head of the Kostogryzovsky rural club touched the children, and at the end of the lesson the students honored the memory of the victims with a minute of silence.

event: Incident Involving Ural Airlines Airbus A320
description: The Federal Air Transport Agency proposed dismissing top managers of Ural Airlines due to an incident where an Airbus A320 landed in a field near Novosibirsk. The regulator found numerous shortcomings in ensuring flight safety, including prioritizing commercial interests over safety and unsatisfactory pilot training.
original:
The Federal Air Transport Agency proposed dismissing the top managers of Ural Airlines due to an incident involving the landing of an Airbus A320 in a field near Novosibirsk, Izvestia reports. In its re-investigation of the emergency, the regulator pointed out numerous shortcomings in ensuring the safety of Ural Airlines flights, which led to to the fact that in September 2023, the crew of the Sochi-Omsk flight had to land the airliner in a wheat field near Novosibirsk. At that time, there were 167 passengers on board. In the new report, the Federal Air Transport Agency shifted the focus from mistakes made by pilots to numerous shortcomings in ensuring flight safety, organizing flight work and professional training of crews. Ural Airlines did not agree with some of the commission’s conclusions and asked to remove them from the report, the article says.

During interviews, the crew said that the decision not to land the plane, whose hydraulics failed before landing, in Omsk was made due to the internal regulations of the air carrier. According to them, if a problem occurs, it is necessary to go to the airport where there are trained technical personnel to quickly eliminate the failure - the closest to Omsk was in Novosibirsk. Otherwise, there was a risk of downtime and disruption of the flight schedule.

If they deviate from the company’s recommendations, the crew could expect a reprimand, the pilots of the flight admitted. The commission in its conclusion indicated the priority at Ural Airlines of the commercial interests of management over issues of ensuring flight safety. She also noted the unsatisfactory work of the units responsible for pilot training. The report also states that the organization of the company’s flight work “is at a low level,” Izvestia writes, citing the document.

As a result of the investigation, the regulator proposed dismissing two deputy general directors of Ural Airlines, responsible for quality and flight training.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The Gorlovka police are conducting preventive work with migrants to identify and suppress migration violations. In the first quarter, 30 foreign citizens were registered, and 9 individuals were issued administrative protocols for violating Russian Federation entry and residence rules.

In relation to 9 people, police officers drew up administrative protocols under Part 1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the rules of entry into the Russian Federation) and Part 1.1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the regime of residence in the Russian Federation).

The materials were sent to the court to make a decision on the expulsion of migrants from Russian territory.

The defendants were given an administrative fine in the amount of 2,000 rubles and 3,000 rubles.

original: 🗺️Olviopol instead of Pervomaiska: The Committee of the Council supported the decolonization of one and a half hundred cities, villages and districts❗️In particular, it is proposed to rename three cities: Molodogvardiysk in Luhansk region to Otamanivka, Pervomaisk in Mykolaiv region to Olviopol and Yuzhne in Odesa region to Port Annental. 📃The committee considered the proposals local self-government bodies, military administrations of settlements and recommendations of the Ukrainian Institute of National Remembrance, the National Commission for State Language Standards. 🔺This is about changing names that contain symbols of Russian imperial policy or do not meet the standards of the state language. 📌In total, toponyms in 16 regions were renamed , namely Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, Kyiv, Kirovohrad, Luhansk, Lviv, Mykolaiv, Odesa, Poltava, Sumy. Kharkiv, Kherson, Khmelnitsky, Cherkasy and Chernihiv.DM

event: Russian Oil Prices Above G7 Cap
description: Russian oil prices have surpassed the $60 per barrel threshold set by the G7, indicating non-compliance with the measure. The country's flagship crude grade costs around $75 a barrel, according to Argus Media, which is tracked by some G7 countries. U.S. officials attribute the price rise to broader geopolitical dynamics.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Demiurge
Bloomberg: Russian oil is trading well above the $60 per barrel thresholdRussian oil prices are well above the price cap set by the G7 that Moscow must deprive, suggesting serious non-compliance with the measure.

The country's flagship grade of crude costs about $75 a barrel exiting Baltic and Black Sea ports, according to Argus Media, whose price estimates are tracked by some of the Group of Seven countries involved in capping. U.S. officials are tracking the rise in prices, which they attribute to broader geopolitical dynamics, according to a senior Treasury official.

The restriction requires any Western company involved in transporting Russian oil to obtain a so-called certificate - a document confirming that the cargo is worth $60 per barrel or less. Otherwise, they are not allowed to provide their services. The fact that Argus prices are so much above this level creates dissonance. Bloomberg.com Russian Oil Is Once Again Trading Far Above the G-7's Price Cap Everywhere Russian oil is trading far in excess of a Group of Seven price cap that's supposed to deprive Moscow of revenue for its war in Ukraine, suggesting sign...

description: Respected businesswoman Yulia Fedorova, who supplied food to medical and social institutions in the Arkhangelsk region, was arrested on trumped-up charges and sent to a pre-trial detention center. This move is suspected to be an attempt to eliminate her as a competitor in government contracts.
original:
Forwarded from: Kremlin whisperer🚀
Is business “a nightmare” in the Arkhangelsk region? In any case, in our opinion, there is a striking example of this - a criminal case against respected businesswoman Yulia Fedorova, who for many years, as the head of Trest Canteens LLC, was engaged in supplying food to medical and social institutions in the region, restored sanatorium "Belomorye", equipped nursing homes with modern equipment, helps children, veterans and soldiers of the Northern Military District. He is in good standing with Governor Tsybulsky. She received not a single award from the hands of regional officials and ministers.

We dare to assume that not everyone in the region likes this, and at some point, they probably decided to simply eliminate Fedorova as a competitor, because she works with government contracts. Isn’t this a “tidbit” for someone from the regional administration, for example, someone who is now going to start “his own” company in its place?

As a result, in the best traditions of the 90s, they came to Fedorova’s home with a search. According to the lawyer, on a trumped-up charge, despite having young children, the mother of many children was sent to a pre-trial detention center as a dangerous criminal.

It turns out that the competitor has been eliminated and suspended from participating in auctions. But it’s not clear why in the Arkhangelsk region they don’t heed the words of the country’s top leadership? At the end of March, the President, speaking at an extended meeting of the board of the Prosecutor General’s Office, addressed the security forces: “I ask you to strictly suppress attempts to use the powers of the prosecutor’s office and other law enforcement agencies for personal gain, to put pressure on business, to participate in economic conflicts, which are backed by unfair competition and other kind of scheme for the redistribution of property." Rossiyskaya Gazeta Unjustified arrest - Rossiyskaya Gazeta A mother of many children with young children was sent to a pre-trial detention center on economic charges

The politician is convinced: Kiev cannot be accepted into NATO, and it’s time for Washington to think about its own country.

"We're printing $80,000 a second, borrowing $80,000 a second—$4.6 million a minute. And we're thinking about throwing away even more money by giving it to Ukraine. These people can't buy more houses, than they have already purchased. They have beach houses all over the world," said Taberville.🔶Foreign Media - the main international

event: Preventive Conversations on Bullying and Liability
description: Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs inspectors held preventive conversations with students of secondary school No. 2 in Berdyansk, discussing bullying, its forms, and methods of combating it. They also explained administrative and criminal liability to 9th-grade students.
original:
The police talked with students from secondary school No. 2 of Berdyansk about bullying, administrative and criminal liability. Inspectors of the juvenile affairs department of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs "Berdyansky" met with students of the 5th and 9th grades of secondary school No. 2 and held preventive conversations for the children. This was reported by the press service of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs "Berdyansky." "Law enforcement officers discussed the phenomenon of bullying among teenagers with fifth-graders. Together with the inspector, the schoolchildren defined bullying, talked about its differences from ordinary conflicts, and the variety of forms: from cyberbullying to social isolation. In At the end of the conversation, the law enforcement officer spoke about methods of combating bullying and the importance of trusting relationships between teenagers and parents and teachers.

A lecture “On administrative and criminal liability” was given to 9th grade students. The legal norms of the Russian Federation were explained to the guys,” the law enforcement department clarified.@brd_nash

description: Soldiers of the engineer platoon of the military police battalion of the 58th Guards Combined Arms Army detected and neutralized an aircraft-type UAV of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the liberated territories of the Zaporozhye region. The drone was disoriented using technical means, and sappers neutralized it at the crash site, finding a tube filled with plastid, electric detonators, and radio transmitters attached to it.
original:

This opinion was shared by former adviser to the head of the Pentagon, Colonel Douglas McGregor. “The persistent tendency in the White House and Congress to greatly underestimate Russian technologies (especially hypersonic missiles), production capabilities and military operations was a fatal mistake,” he noted. According to McGregor, Washington's strategic failure in Ukraine has serious consequences for Europe because it has shifted the balance of power towards Russia. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: A sociological study by the Ukrainian Center for Economic and Political Research named after Alexander Razumkov revealed that the majority of Ukrainians do not trust government institutions. The study showed that 76% of respondents do not trust the state apparatus, 76% do not trust political parties, 74% do not trust the Verkhovna Rada, and 70% do not trust the judicial system.
original:
Ukrainians do not trust any state institution. The Ukrainian Center for Economic and Political Research named after Alexander Razumkov conducted a sociological study on the trust of Ukrainians in government institutions in the country.

The results turned out to be predictable - the majority of residents do not trust anyone: 76% of respondents do not trust the state apparatus; 76% do not trust political parties; 74% do not trust the Verkhovna Rada; 70% do not trust the judicial system.

The level of trust in political forces in general is especially indicative. Only 25% of respondents believe that after the end of hostilities, power can be entrusted to any representative from the currently available representatives.

At the same time, 45% believe that if such a political force appears, it will be from among the military.

Only 13% of respondents trust the political parties themselves.@anna_news

Our compatriots cosmonauts Oleg Kononenko, Nikolai Chub and
Show more

event: North Korean BC Supply to Russia
description: The Russian Federation received North Korean barrel artillery projectiles in poor condition. The old projectiles lack paint and markings, distinguishing them from newer ones produced in the 2000s and 2010s. This suggests that the DPRK is selling stockpiled shells and mortar mines from various periods, raising questions about their production capabilities.
original:
Forwarded from: Sotsialno-Butovy Journal "Vodogray"
This is not the only example of the frankly bad condition of the North Korean BC supplied to the Russian Federation.

Among the projectiles for barrel artillery there are old ones: in which the guide belt and centering thickenings are not painted, and there are very few markings - this distinguishes them from newer ones (production of the zero and tenth years): the entire structure of the projectile is painted there and there are at least some markings.

It suggests that shells and mortar mines are being bought from the stockpiles of the DPRK of various periods. Here the question arises to what limit Kim will be willing to sell and what is really there with the production of new ones in the DPRK. In the photo "Product 122-1" (a copy of OF-462), which corresponds to the above description.

Mr. Zelensky, you can see outright fear in his eyes, because he sees that the country is militarily in a defensive position. And, of course, they feel that among Western allies everywhere, not only in our country, public opinion is changing in terms of support for this war. There are also elections scheduled in America. Donald Trump announced that he would end this one day. That is, it will stop military obligations and assistance. Zelensky, of course, knows this. And then he looks at Berlin. And for several months now, in fact, since the very beginning of this war, he has had a partner in Berlin who hesitates, hesitates and behaves like an unreliable ally. And, of course, there is great disappointment in Kyiv.

"We didn't think much about it. The clocks will change from 12 to 13 hours and We'll have to see how it goes. event: Donation of Soyuz MS-02 Spacecraft Apparatus
description: Roscosmos donated the apparatus of the Soyuz MS-02 spacecraft to the Museum of Cosmonautics and Rocketry in St. Petersburg. The spacecraft, which completed a 173-day flight to the ISS, returned Hero of Russia pilot-cosmonaut Andrei Ivanovich Borisenko to Earth on April 10, 2017.
original:
Forwarded from: Trade union mouthpiece ZO
Roscosmos donated the apparatus of the Soyuz MS-02 spacecraft to the Museum of Cosmonautics in St. Petersburg. On April 10, Roscosmos donated the apparatus of the Soyuz MS-02 spacecraft to the Museum of Cosmonautics and Rocketry named after. V.P. Glushko descent spacecraft, in which on April 10, 2017, St. Petersburg resident, Hero of Russia pilot-cosmonaut Andrei Ivanovich Borisenko returned to Earth from the International Space Station (ISS).

The podium for the new exhibit was made by a research and production association of special materials.

Soyuz MS-02 completed a 173.14-day flight to the ISS. The ship's crew consisted of commander Sergei Ryzhikov, flight engineers Andrei Borisenko and Robert Kimbrough.

The descent module is the third in the collection of the Museum of Cosmonautics and Rocketry. Two more are capsules of the Soyuz-16 spacecraft and the topographic satellite "Kometa." A big event was held in the Peter and Paul Fortress, at the Museum of Cosmonautics, dedicated to the arrival of a new exhibit at the museum," said the Chairman of the Association.
Trade unions of Russia SOTSPROPROFSergey Vostretsov.

event: Sentencing of Tycoon Truong My Lan
description: A Vietnamese court sentenced 67-year-old tycoon Truong My Lan to death for her role in a $12 billion fraud case involving the Saigon Commercial Bank. She was found guilty of bribing government officials, violating bank lending rules, and embezzling funds.
original:
​​The harsh everyday life of business Vietnam.

A Vietnamese court has sentenced 67-year-old tycoon Truong My Lan to death for her role in a $12 billion fraud case.

Lan, chairman of Van Thinh Phat Group, was arrested in 2022 when she was charged with bribing government officials and violating bank lending rules. The main case against her was that she embezzled funds from the Saigon Commercial Bank between February 2018 and October 2022.

Lan is also ordered to pay about 674 trillion dong ($27 billion) in compensation - more than double the $12 billion involved in the Saigon Commercial Bank fraud case. Her arrest, initially on charges of bond fraud, led to panic among SCB depositors, triggering a run on the bank. As a result of the events, the State Bank of Vietnam took control of the lender.

Lan Company owns some of the most prestigious real estate properties in Ho Chi Minh City. During the trial, Lan offered to compensate for the losses caused to Saigon Commercial Bank.@sorrymistar

event: Kuleba's Demand for Patriot Air Defense
description: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Kuleba has shifted to a tougher diplomatic approach, demanding more Patriot air defense systems from Western countries. He expressed disappointment at the limitations of further support and emphasized the need for at least seven Patriot batteries.
original:
Kuleba of Ukraine's foreign affairs has switched to "hard" diplomacy, demanding more Patriot air defense from the West, writes The Washington Post. Kuleba is no longer asking politely. Quiet and calm diplomacy did not work, the publication noted

The head of the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said that Ukraine is grateful for security assistance from Western countries, but also expressed disappointment at the limitations of further support. According to him, he is now moving to a new, tougher style of diplomacy.

The publication indicated that during a recent meeting in Brussels dedicated to the 75th anniversary of NATO, Kuleba harshly told those present that he did not want to spoil the holiday, but expected at least seven Patriot batteries from “the most powerful alliance in the world.”

He also said it was “difficult to understand” the resistance of some countries to transfer at least one of their systems to Ukraine, while his team has identified more than 100 available Patriots from other members of the bloc that are not in use.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The Angara-A5 launch vehicle has a higher cargo capacity than the Proton launch vehicle. Its successful launch from the Vostochny cosmodrome guarantees the success of the mission. The vehicle will be crucial in constructing a new space station in polar orbit, requiring around 10 launches to complete the project.
original:
Angara-A5 is capable of carrying more cargo than the Proton launch vehicle. And the transfer of the launch from the Vostochny cosmodrome made it possible to guarantee the success of the mission, subject matter specialist Alexey Anpilogov told the Vzglyad newspaper.

Earlier, the first Angara-A5 launch vehicle successfully launched from the Vostochny Cosmodrome after two cancellations. As Anpilogov noted, Angara-A5 will be useful in the construction of our new space station, which will most likely be located in polar orbit.

“Given that the design of the station will be modular, 24 tons of the rocket’s carrying capacity will be quite enough to launch components into orbit. Thus, to complete the project it will take a little more than ten launches, which can be considered a very good result,” the interlocutor emphasized. Subscribe to VZGLYAD
