event: Burkina Faso Becomes Leading Strawberry Producer
description: Burkina Faso has surpassed Senegal to become the top strawberry producer in West Africa, with an annual production of over 2,000 tons. The strawberry agricultural campaign in 2019-2020 generated a turnover of more than 2 billion CFA francs (approximately 3 million Euro).
original:
Forwarded from: Africa News Feed
🇧🇫Burkina Faso has overtaken Senegal to become the leading strawberry producer in West Africa with more than 2,000 tons of strawberries per year.

According to the Burkina Faso Agricultural Entrepreneurship Development Support Program (Programme d'appui à la promotion de l'entrepreneuriat agricole - PAPEA), the turnover of the strawberry agricultural campaign in 2019-2020 amounted to more than 2 billion CFA francs (about 3 million Euro).
“You might think it would be strange to grow strawberries in a Sahelian country like Burkina Faso, but this has been the reality since the 1970s,” says one local grower named Madi Compaoré. At that time, the crop was “introduced thanks to a French emigrant who brought some plants for his garden,” he explains. TV5 Monde

description: Russian forces successfully destroyed an American-made MUTT robotic wheeled platform using an attack FPV drone on the Artyomovsky Front. The platform, with a carrying capacity of 500 kg, was capable of evacuation operations, ammunition delivery, and fire support tasks.
original:
The multi-purpose robotic wheeled platform MUTT with an 8x8 wheel arrangement from the American company Dynamics Land Systems was successfully hit by an attack FPV drone of the Russian army on one of the operational directions of the Artyomovsky Front. The platform's carrying capacity is about 500 kg, which allows for evacuation operations, or the delivery of ammunition and provisions to the LBS, as well as fire support tasks when equipped with various types of combat modules.

The main advantage of this enemy platform is the range on a single charge of a block of parallel coupled lithium-ion batteries of about 58 km on the highway and 50 km on hard dirt roads, or 30-35 km on rough terrain.

In the case of crossing a water obstacle in a calm state, the range of action is noticeably reduced, and the load capacity is reduced to 250 kg. There are also tracked modifications of this complex with a range of up to 97 km.

A similar domestic platform with a payload capacity of up to 1000 kg is the TX-45SM “Tosha” platform (video No.) with a 6x6 wheel arrangement and a range of 20 to 200 km, depending on the optionally added volume of batteries. A domestic platform was developed by IP Drobyshev A.N. The speed of the TX-45SM reaches 70 km/h while maintaining the minimum infrared signature of structural elements.@RussianArmsRAMSAY

event: Approval of Draft Measure to Combat Fictitious Marriages
description: The State Duma approved a draft measure in the first reading, establishing a minimum two-year period of marriage to a Russian citizen for foreign citizens to obtain a temporary residence permit in a simplified manner. The aim is to combat fictitious marriages and documents for obtaining citizenship.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
The Duma in the first reading approved a draft measure to combat fictitious marriages for obtaining citizenship. The State Duma at the plenary meeting in the first reading adopted a bill establishing for foreign citizens a minimum two-year period of being married to a citizen of the Russian Federation in order to obtain a temporary residence permit in a simplified manner. The press service of the parliament reported this. “After the adoption of the law, foreign citizens married to Russians will be able to obtain permission for temporary residence in Russia outside the established quotas only if the spouses have lived together for at least two years. In addition, the amendments are aimed at combating cases of issuing fictitious documents on the adoption of children by foreigners for the purpose of obtaining permission to stay in Russia,” said State Duma Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin. Subscribe to the Kherson News Agency in TG, VK and OK

description: Delta Air Lines' Airbus A350, featuring a special Olympic livery, made its first flight on April 10, 2024, in Toulouse, France. Delta is the official carrier of the US National Olympic Team and has a sponsorship commitment with the US Olympic and Paralympic Committees.
original:
Airbus A350 Delta Air Lines for the US Olympic Team On April 10, 2024, another “Olympic aircraft” of Delta Air Lines in a special livery made its first flight in Toulouse, France, where the Airbus plant is located.

The airline has a sponsorship commitment with the US Olympic and Paralympic Committees starting in 2020. It is also one of the official sponsors of the 2028 Olympic Games, which will be held in Los Angeles. And on top of that, Delta is the official carrier of the US National Olympic Team. In 2021, ahead of the Summer Olympics in Beijing, Delta unveiled its first "Olympic" aircraft - an Airbus A330-900 in the "Team USA" livery. Later this year, Delta will also receive an A350-900 in a special "LA 2028" livery.

Photo©Clément Alloing@AviaNews

description: A meeting was held with Senator Natalya Nikonorova to discuss issues affecting residents of the Donetsk People's Republic, including personnel shortages, obtaining 'disabled combatants' status for defenders of Donbass, and adopting laws on free legal assistance and conferring the title 'Veteran of Labor of the Donetsk People's Republic'.
original:
Today we discussed with Senator of the Russian Federation Natalya Nikonorova the issues that residents of the Donetsk People’s Republic are addressing, as well as the current legislative work.

Natalya Yuryevna spoke about the work done by the Council for the Integration of Reunited Territories under the Federation Council. The senator noted that active work is underway to solve the problem of personnel shortage in the Republic, as well as to work on obtaining the status of “disabled combatants” for the defenders of Donbass. We discussed the possibility of obtaining the corresponding status for the first wave of militias. It is gratifying to hear that the wishes and problems arising from the residents of our Republic are heard at the federal level!

I would also note that the work of the People’s Council deputies and the Senator is structured systematically. As Natalya Yuryevna put it, we “regularly synchronize our watches.”

The importance of adopting a law on free legal assistance was discussed at the meeting. Let me clarify that this bill has been registered and work is underway in the relevant committee. Equally important is the development of a bill on conferring the title “Veteran of Labor of the Donetsk People’s Republic.”

During an active dialogue, deputies of the People's Council and Natalya Nikonorova discussed issues of recognizing departmental awards of the Donetsk People's Republic, as well as protecting the rights of citizens in the field of property relations.

Together with Natalya Yuryevna, they noted the importance of holding receptions for citizens in the districts. It is the citizens of our Republic who are the engine of legislative activity, passing on their orders, questions and problems to parliamentarians for further development.

description: Ethiopia may need to devalue its national currency, the Ethiopian birr, to secure a financial aid package from the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The country has defaulted on its debt obligations and has not received IMF funds since 2020. A bridge loan of $3.5 billion is being sought to overcome the default.
original:
Ethiopia will apparently have to undergo a significant devaluation of its national currency, the Ethiopian birr, in order to receive a financial aid package from the International Monetary Fund. Last week's negotiations with IMF representatives on this subject ended in nothing.

Ethiopia has become the third African state in recent years to default on its debt obligations. Formally, the technical default took place in December 2023.

Ethiopia has not received any funds from the IMF since 2020, that is, since the beginning of the Tigray unrest, and its most recent loan agreement with the IMF was terminated in 2021. But even after the signing of the Praetorian-Nairobi peace agreements in the fall of 2022, there was no turning point in relations with the IMF. In a communique following recent negotiations, the IMF made no mention of the need to devalue the birr, but it usually advocates a flexible market exchange rate for the national currency.

To overcome the default, Ethiopia would like to receive a bridge loan in the amount of $3.5 billion.

Chronic shortages of foreign currency and the government's tightly controlled exchange rate for the Ethiopian birr have led to a thriving black market, with the US dollar currently trading at between 117 and 120 birr, more than double the official rate of about 56.7 birr to the dollar. .https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/ethiopia-faces-tough-devaluation-decision-secure-imf-bailout-2024-04-11/ReutersEthiopia faces tough devaluation decision to secure IMF bailoutEthiopia may have to decide on a big currency devaluation sooner rather than later to secure a rescue loan from the International Monetary Fund (IMF),...
